Linux-Binary:
# This option allows to download a single executable file
# While this is most convenient option, it may perform slow if your environment doesn't offer fast disks. Consider using Linux-Tarball in such cases
mkdir -p ~/pipe
# For el6 Linux (e.g. Centos 6, RHEL 6) use \
Linux-Tarball:
# This option provides a much better performance for the environments with slow disks
# Tarball shall be unpacked manually after downloading
cd ~
# For el6 Linux (e.g. Centos 6, RHEL 6) use \
Windows:
1. Download CLI using URL: https://${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_HOST}:${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_PORT}/pipeline/pipe.zip
2. Extract archieve to C:\Users\<YOUR_NAME>\pipe
- Navigate to C:\Users\<YOUR_NAME>\Downloads
- Right-click 'pipe.zip' and click 'Extract all'
- Enter 'C:\Users\<YOUR_NAME>\pipe\' in the 'Destination path'
- Click 'Extract'
3. Open Windows Console and add CLI to the PATH
- Click 'Start' and run 'cmd' application
- In the Console window type 'setx PATH \
Other:
# Distribution for the other OS types (non-Win/non-Linux) is provided as a sources tarball
# This requires the Python 2 or Python 3 environment to be available
mkdir -p ~/pipe
wget -k 'https://${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_HOST}:${CP_API_SRV_EXTERNAL_PORT}/pipeline/PipelineCLI.tar.gz' -O ~/pipe/PipelineCLI.tar.gz
pip install --user ~/pipe/PipelineCLI.tar.gz
